Title: How To Achieve Primal Union ｜ Tao Te Ching Explained ｜ Chapter 13
Content: 1. Reflect on how favor and disgrace can evoke similar fears in us, stemming from our primal instincts for social survival. 2. Recognize that modern social rejection still triggers intense fear in the brain, similar to the perceived threat of death in prehistoric times. 3. Understand that seeking constant social validation can lead to a state of perpetual insecurity and fear of loss. 4. Practice shifting focus from personal social validation to a broader sense of oneness and care for all beings. 5. Consider that the key to overcoming fear of favor and disgrace lies in transcending self-centered concerns and embracing a more inclusive perspective on social interactions.
